sub_topic: Calculation of the power output of an electrochemical cell
message_1: What is the power output of a galvanic cell if the electromotive force (EMF) is 1.50 V and the cell current is 0.200 A? The cell consists of a zinc electrode in a solution of zinc sulfate and a copper electrode in a solution of copper sulfate. The zinc electrode is the anode and the copper electrode is the cathode. The standard reduction potentials for Zn2+ and Cu2+ are -0.763 V and 0.337 V, respectively.
message_2:
To calculate the power output of the galvanic cell, we can use the formula:

Power (P) = Voltage (V) × Current (I)

Given the electromotive force (EMF) is 1.50 V and the cell current is 0.200 A, we can plug these values into the formula:

P = 1.50 V × 0.200 A

P = 0.300 W

The power output of the galvanic cell is 0.300 watts.
